definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to engage (a teacher etc)/to hire/to betroth/betrothal gift/to get married (of woman)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Employment interview is the process of transferring information between interviewers and interviewees.
sentences.chinese: 面试是面试官与应聘者进行面对面交流的过程。

sentences.english: Xu believes that stress has become a common problem for employees.
sentences.chinese: 徐永革认为应聘者普遍存在的问题是压力。

sentences.english: Many employers also check whether potential hires can speak Mandarin.
sentences.chinese: 许多用人单位也会核查应聘者是否会讲普通话。

sentences.english: During a phone interview the candidate flushed the toilet while talking to hiring manager.
sentences.chinese: 应聘者在一次电话面试外边和招聘经理谈话边冲马桶。

sentences.english: Secondly, an interviewee must demonstrate his skills for the job.
sentences.chinese: 其次，应聘者要证明自己能胜任这份工作。

sentences.english: “This also helps you become a better interviewee, ” Richards says.
sentences.chinese: 这可以帮助你成为一个更好的应聘者”，理查兹说。

sentences.english: The applicant smelled his armpits on the way to the interview room。
sentences.chinese: 应聘者闻着腋窝走进面试房间。

sentences.english: Some candidates don'tto spell the company's name correctly.
sentences.chinese: 一些应聘者都懒得把公司的名称拼写正确。

sentences.english: A friend or lover—I can see that. But an employer?
sentences.chinese: 朋友还是情人我能了解，但是通过一个应聘者做到呢？

sentences.english: Some candidates giggled nervously as they waited for the interview.
sentences.chinese: 一些应聘者在等待面试的时候紧张的傻笑。

sentences.english: During a phone interview the candidate flushed the toilet while talking to hiring manager。
sentences.chinese: 应聘者在一次电话面试中边和招聘经理谈话边冲马桶。

sentences.english: An interviewer hosts the meeting in an office setting where a friendly conversation takes place between two people.
sentences.chinese: 在一间办公室里，面试官和应聘者进行融洽的交流。

sentences.english: This question is one of the most tricky questions for fresh graduates.
sentences.chinese: 对于应届生应聘者来说，对这个问题是最易陷入圈套。

sentences.english: This is particularly important if the firm is in a different industry than the one you worked in before.
sentences.chinese: 对于跨行业的应聘者来说，这一点尤其重要。

sentences.english: Candidates who don’t ask questions also come across as unprepared and unengaged.
sentences.chinese: 应聘者没有问题同样被看作是没有准备和没有事的。

sentences.english: You are now working with or within the animal health industry.
sentences.chinese: 应聘者需是动物保健行业的在业人员或相关人员。
